Mental verb-QI with -me have ironic or conditional semantics.  [Yakovlev 1941: 142]

Suffix -m merges with additive marker -i ... As far as such verbs as 'know' have a conditiocal meaning in case a dependent predicate is marked with -me, marker -mi is used in questions to avoid conditional meaning.  [Yakovlev 1941: 142]
In regular complementation verb 'know' requires participle strategy, but it is not so easy for reported questions. Someone use participle strategy, someone not.
That is default a strategy for polar questions, and it as almost does not used in wh-questions. That is the most frequent strategy.

That is a specific strategy, that may be used in any question type. It is used in situation of self-reflection, hesitation or inner mogologue. So, it is frequently used with appropriate verbs and forbidden with a verb 'know' in non-negative form.
Construction is used only in independent and reported questions, but it seems to be more frequent in reported ones. Question particles are optional.
